newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Palestinian stock exchange doubles trading days.
newsitem.headline: Palestinian stock exchange doubles trading days.

text.p: The Palestine Securities Exchange said on Monday it would double its trading sessions to twice a week starting on July 13.
General Manager Safwan Bataina said the stock market in the West Bank town of Nablus, which opened in February, would be open for trading from 9 a.m. to noon on Sundays and Wednesdays.
The $2 million electronic bourse opened in February hoping to attract long-term investment from expatriate Palestinians.
Shares closed mixed last Tuesday with trading volume almost double the previous week's level. The exchange has yet to issue an index.
